CssAtDirective.name: -ms-keyframes
CssAtDirective.description: Defines set of animation key frames.

CssPseudo.name: ::-ms-browse
CssPseudo.description: Applies one or more styles to the browse button of an input type=file control.

CssPseudo.name: ::-ms-check
CssPseudo.description: Applies one or more styles to the check of a checkbox or radio button input control.

CssPseudo.name: ::-ms-clear
CssPseudo.description: Applies one or more styles to the entry area of a text input control when it contains no content.

CssPseudo.name: ::-ms-expand
CssPseudo.description: Applies one or more styles to the drop-down button of a select control.

CssPseudo.name: ::-ms-fill
CssPseudo.description: Applies one or more styles to the bar portion of a progress bar.

CssPseudo.name: ::-ms-fill-lower
CssPseudo.description: Applies one or more styles to portion of the slider track from its smallest value up to the value currently selected by the thumb. In a left-to-right layout, this is the portion of the slider track to the left of the thumb.

CssPseudo.name: ::-ms-fill-upper
CssPseudo.description: Applies one or more styles to portion of the slider track from the value currently selected by the thumb up to the slider's largest value. In a left-to-right layout, this is the portion of the slider track to the right of the thumb.

CssPseudo.name: ::-ms-reveal
CssPseudo.description: Applies one or more styles to the password reveal button of an input type=password control.

CssPseudo.name: ::-ms-thumb
CssPseudo.description: Applies one or more styles to portion of the range input control (also known as a slider control) that the user drags.

CssPseudo.name: ::-ms-ticks-after
CssPseudo.description: Applies one or more styles to the tick marks of a slider that begin just after the thumb and continue up to the slider's largest value. In a left-to-right layout, these are the ticks to the right of the thumb.

CssPseudo.name: ::-ms-ticks-before
CssPseudo.description: Applies one or more styles to the tick marks of a slider that represent its smallest values up to the value currently selected by the thumb. In a left-to-right layout, these are the ticks to the left of the thumb.

CssPseudo.name: ::-ms-tooltip
CssPseudo.description: Applies one or more styles to the tooltip of a slider (input type=range).

CssPseudo.name: ::-ms-track
CssPseudo.description: Applies one or more styles to track of a slider.

CssPseudo.name: ::-ms-value
CssPseudo.description: Applies one or more styles to the content of a text or password input control, or a select control.

CssPseudo.name: :-ms-lang(en)
CssPseudo.description: The pseudo-class :-ms-lang(C) represents an element that is in language C.

CssProperty.name: zoom
CssProperty.description: Sets or retrieves the magnification scale of the object.

CssProperty.name: filter
CssProperty.description: IE only. Used to produce visual effects.

CssProperty.name: behavior
CssProperty.description: IE only. Used to extend behaviors of the browser

CssProperty.name: -ms-accelerator
CssProperty.description: IE only. Has the ability to turn off its system underlines for accelerator keys until the ALT key is pressed

entry.description: The element contains an accelerator key sequence.
The element does not contain an accelerator key sequence.

CssProperty.name: -ms-line-break
CssProperty.description: Specifies what set of line breaking restrictions are in effect within the element.

entry.description: The UA determines the set of line-breaking restrictions to use for CJK scripts, and it may vary the restrictions based on the length of the line; e.g., use a less restrictive set of line-break rules for short lines.
Breaks CJK scripts using the least restrictive set of line-breaking rules. Typically used for short lines, such as in newspapers.
Breaks CJK scripts using a normal set of line-breaking rules.
Breaks CJK scripts using a more restrictive set of line-breaking rules than 'normal'.

Sequences of CJK characters can no longer break on implied break points. This option should only be used where the presence of word separator characters still creates line-breaking opportunities, as in Korean.

CssProperty.name: -ms-text-underline-position
CssProperty.description: Sets the position of an underline specified on the same element: it does not affect underlines specified by ancestor elements.This property is typically used in vertical writing contexts such as in Japanese documents where it often desired to have the underline appear 'over' (to the right of) the affected run of text

entry.description: The user agent may use any algorithm to determine the underline's position. In horizontal line layout, the underline should be aligned as for alphabetic. In vertical line layout, if the language is set to Japanese or Korean, the underline should be aligned as for over.

The underline is aligned with the 'bottom' (left in vertical writing) edge of the element's em-box. In this case the underline usually does not cross the descenders. This is sometimes called 'accounting' underline.
The underline is aligned with the alphabetic baseline. In this case the underline is likely to cross some descenders.
The underline is aligned with the 'top' (right in vertical writing) edge of the element's em-box. In this mode, an overline also switches sides.

CssProperty.name: -ms-text-autospace
CssProperty.description: Determines whether or not a full-width punctuation mark character should be trimmed if it appears at the beginning of a line, so that its 'ink' lines up with the first glyph in the line above and below.

entry.description: No extra space is created.
Creates 1/4em extra spacing between runs of ideographic letters and numeric glyphs.
Creates 1/4em extra spacing between runs of ideographic letters and non-ideographic letters, such as Latin-based, Cyrillic, Greek, Arabic or Hebrew.
Extends the width of the space character while surrounded by ideographs.
Creates extra spacing between normal (non wide) parenthesis and ideographs.
Creates extra non-breaking spacing around punctuation as required by language-specific typographic conventions.

CssProperty.name: -ms-transform-origin-x
CssProperty.description: The x coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

CssProperty.name: -ms-transform-origin-y
CssProperty.description: The y coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

CssProperty.name: -ms-transform-origin-z
CssProperty.description: The z coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

CssProperty.name: -ms-block-progression
CssProperty.description: The 'block-progression' property sets the block-progression value and the flow orientation

entry.description: Bottom-to-top block flow. Layout is horizontal.

CssProperty.name: -ms-writing-mode
CssProperty.description: This is a shorthand property for both 'direction' and 'block-progression'.

entry.description: A value of grid causes an element to display as a block-level Grid element
A value of inline-grid causes an element to display as an inline-level Grid element.

CssProperty.name: -ms-grid-layer
CssProperty.description: Grid-layer is similar in concept to z-index, but avoids overloading the meaning of the z-index property, which is applicable only to positioned elements.

CssProperty.name: -ms-flex
CssProperty.description: specifies the parameters of a flexible length: the positive and negative flexibility, and the preferred size.

CssProperty.name: -ms-flex-align
CssProperty.description: The 'flex-align' property changes the way free space is allocated in the length axis.

CssProperty.name: -ms-flex-direction
CssProperty.description: Specifies how flexbox items are placed in the flexbox.

CssProperty.name: -ms-flex-item-align
CssProperty.description: The 'flex-align' property changes the way free space is allocated in the length axis.

CssProperty.name: -ms-flex-line-pack
CssProperty.description: The 'flex-line-pack' property aligns a flexbox's lines within the flexbox when there is extra space in the cross axis, similar to how 'flex-pack' aligns individual items within the main axis.

entry.description: Lines stretch to take up the remaining space. If the leftover free-space is negative, this value is identical to 'start'.

CssProperty.name: -ms-flex-order
CssProperty.description: This property is an integer with an initial value of 1.

CssProperty.name: -ms-flex-pack
CssProperty.description: The 'flex-pack' property defines the flexibility of these packing spaces.

entry.description: The flexbox item's margin box is centered in the cross axis within the line.
If the cross size property of the flexbox item is anything other than 'auto', this value is identical to 'start'.
Align all flexbox items so that their baselines line up, then distribute free space above and below the content.
The cross-start margin edge of the flexbox item is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the line.
The cross-end margin edge of the flexbox item is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the line.

For normal direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child. For reverse direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child.

For normal direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child. For reverse direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child.
The extra space is divided evenly, with half placed before the first child and the other half placed after the last child.

The space is divided evenly in-between each child, with none of the extra space placed before the first child or after the last child. If there is only one child, treat the pack value as if it were start.
Lines are evenly distributed in the flexbox, with half-size spaces on either end.

CssProperty.name: scrollbar-arrow-color
CssProperty.description: Determines the color of the arrow elements of a scroll arrow.

CssProperty.name: scrollbar-3dlight-color
CssProperty.description: Determines the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

CssProperty.name: scrollbar-base-color
CssProperty.description: Determines the color of the main elements of a scroll bar, which include the scroll box, track, and scroll arrows.

CssProperty.name: scrollbar-darkshadow-color
CssProperty.description: Determines the color of the gutter of a scroll bar.

CssProperty.name: scrollbar-face-color
CssProperty.description: Determines the color of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

CssProperty.name: scrollbar-highlight-color
CssProperty.description: Determines the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

CssProperty.name: scrollbar-shadow-color
CssProperty.description: Determines the color of the bottom and right edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

CssProperty.name: scrollbar-track-color
CssProperty.description: Determines the color of the track element of a scroll bar.

CssProperty.name: -ms-content-zooming
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether zooming is enabled.

CssProperty.name: -ms-content-zoom-snap
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a shorthand value that sets values for the -ms-content-zoom-snap-type and the -ms-content-zoom-snap-points properties.

CssProperty.name: -ms-content-zoom-snap-type
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that indicates how zooming is affected by defined snap-points.

CssProperty.name: -ms-content-zoom-snap-points
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that defines where zoom snap-points are located.

CssProperty.name: -ms-content-zoom-chaining
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that indicates the zoom behavior that occurs when a user hits the content boundary during a manipulation.

CssProperty.name: -ms-content-zoom-limit
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a shorthand value that sets values for the -ms-content-zoom-limit-min and the -ms-content-zoom-limit-max properties.

CssProperty.name: -ms-content-zoom-limit-min
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum value for the msContentZoomFactor property.

CssProperty.name: -ms-content-zoom-limit-max
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum value for the msContentZoomFactor property.

CssProperty.name: -ms-user-select
CssProperty.description: Controls the appearance of selection.

CssProperty.name: -ms-wrap-flow
CssProperty.description: An element becomes an exclusion when its 'wrap-flow' property has a computed value other than 'auto'.

entry.description: For floats an exclusion is created, for all other elements an exclusion is not created.
Inline flow content can flow on all sides of the exclusion.
Inline flow content can wrap on the start edge of the exclusion area but must leave the area to end edge of the exclusion area empty.
Inline flow content can wrap on the end side of the exclusion area but must leave the area to the start edge of the exclusion area empty.
Inline flow content can wrap on the side of the exclusion with the largest available space for the given line, and must leave the other side of the exclusion empty.
Inline flow content can only wrap on top and bottom of the exclusion and must leave the areas to the start and end edges of the exclusion box empty.

CssProperty.name: -ms-wrap-margin
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that is used to offset the inner wrap shape from other shapes.

CssProperty.name: -ms-wrap-through
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that specifies how content should wrap around an exclusion element.

entry.description: The exclusion element inherits its parent node's wrapping context. Its descendant inline content wraps around exclusions defined outside the element.
The exclusion element does not inherit its parent node's wrapping context. Its descendants are only subject to exclusion shapes defined inside the element.

CssProperty.name: -ms-scroll-chaining
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that indicates the scrolling behavior that occurs when a user hits the content boundary during a manipulation.

CssProperty.name: -ms-scroll-rails
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether or not small motions perpendicular to the primary axis of motion will result in either changes to both the scrollTop and scrollLeft properties or a change to the primary axis (for instance, either the scrollTop or scrollLeft properties will change, but not both).

CssProperty.name: -ms-scroll-snap-points-x
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that defines where snap-points will be located along the x-axis.

CssProperty.name: -ms-scroll-snap-points-y
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that defines where snap-points will be located along the y-axis.

CssProperty.name: -ms-scroll-snap-type
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that defines what type of snap-point should be used for the current element. There are two type of snap-points, with the primary difference being whether or not the user is guaranteed to always stop on a snap-point.

CssProperty.name: -ms-scroll-snap-x
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a shorthand value that sets values for the -ms-scroll-snap-type and -ms-scroll-snap-points-x properties.

CssProperty.name: -ms-scroll-snap-y
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a shorthand value that sets values for the -ms-scroll-snap-type and -ms-scroll-snap-points-y properties.

CssProperty.name: -ms-scroll-limit-x-max
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum value for the scrollLeft property.

CssProperty.name: -ms-scroll-limit-x-min
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum value for the scrollLeft property.

CssProperty.name: -ms-scroll-limit-y-max
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum value for the scrollTop property.

CssProperty.name: -ms-scroll-limit-y-min
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum value for the scrollTop property.

CssProperty.name: -ms-scroll-limit
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a shorthand value that sets values for the -ms-scroll-limit-x-min, -ms-scroll-limit-y-min, -ms-scroll-limit-x-max, and -ms-scroll-limit-y-max properties.

CssProperty.name: -ms-scroll-translation
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether vertical-to-horizontal scroll wheel translation occurs on the specified element.

CssProperty.name: -ms-touch-action
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether and how a given region can be manipulated by the user.

entry.description: The element is a passive element, with several exceptions.
The element is a manipulation-blocking element.
The element permits touch-driven panning on the horizontal axis. The touch pan is performed on the nearest ancestor with horizontally scrollable content.
The element permits touch-driven panning on the vertical axis. The touch pan is performed on the nearest ancestor with vertically scrollable content.
The element permits pinch-zooming. The pinch-zoom is performed on the nearest ancestor with zoomable content.
The element is a manipulation-causing element.
The element will zoom on double-tap.

CssProperty.name: -ms-touch-select
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that toggles the 'gripper' visual elements that enable touch text selection.

entry.description: Grippers are always on.
Grippers are always off.

CssProperty.name: -ms-zoom-animation
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether an animation is used when zooming.

CssProperty.name: -ms-overflow-style
CssProperty.description: Specify whether content is clipped when it overflows the element's content area.

entry.description: No preference, UA should use the first scrolling method in the list that it supports.

Scrollbars are typically narrow strips inserted on one or two edges of an element and which often have arrows to click on and a "thumb" to drag up and down (or left and right) to move the contents of the element.
Indicates the element does not display scrollbars or panning indicators, even when its content overflows.
Indicates the element displays auto-hiding scrollbars during mouse interactions and panning indicators during touch and keyboard interactions.
Indicates a wider value relative to the width of the parent element.
Indicates a narrower value relative to the width of the parent element.

CssProperty.name: background-position-x
CssProperty.description: If background images have been specified, this property specifies their initial position (after any resizing) within their corresponding background positioning area.

CssProperty.name: background-position-y
CssProperty.description: If background images have been specified, this property specifies their initial position (after any resizing) within their corresponding background positioning area.

CssProperty.name: -ms-hyphenate-limit-chars
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets one to three values that indicates the minimum number of characters in a hyphenated word.

CssProperty.name: -ms-hyphenate-limit-lines
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that indicates the maximum number of consecutive lines in an element that may be ended with a hyphenated word.

CssProperty.name: -ms-hyphenate-limit-zone
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that defines the width of the hyphenation zone.

CssProperty.name: -ms-high-contrast-adjust
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to override any Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) properties that would have been set in high contrast mode.

CssProperty.name: -ms-layout-grid
CssProperty.description: Sets or retrieves the composite document grid properties that specify the layout of text characters.

entry.description: Any of the range of mode values available to the -ms-layout-grid-mode property.
Any of the range of type values available to the -ms-layout-grid-type property.
Any of the range of line values available to the -ms-layout-grid-line property.
Any of the range of character values available to the -ms-layout-grid-char property.

CssProperty.name: -ms-layout-grid-char
CssProperty.description: Sets or retrieves the size of the character grid used for rendering the text content of an element.

entry.description: Default. No character grid is set.
Largest character in the font of the element is used to set the character grid.

CssProperty.name: -ms-layout-grid-line
CssProperty.description: Sets or retrieves the gridline value used for rendering the text content of an element.

entry.description: Default. No grid line is set.
Largest character in the font of the element is used to set the character grid.

CssProperty.name: -ms-layout-grid-mode
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets whether the text layout grid uses two dimensions.

entry.description: Default. Both the char and line grid modes are enabled. This setting is necessary to fully enable the layout grid on an element.
No grid is used.
Only a line grid is used. This is recommended for use with inline elements, such as a span, to disable the horizontal grid on runs of text that act as a single entity in the grid layout.
Only a character grid is used. This is recommended for use with block-level elements, such as a blockquote, where the line grid is intended to be disabled.

CssProperty.name: -ms-layout-grid-type
CssProperty.description: Sets or retrieves the type of grid used for rendering the text content of an element.

entry.description: Default. Grid used for Japanese and Korean characters.
Grid used for Chinese, as well as Japanese (Genko) and Korean characters. Only the ideographs, kanas, and wide characters are snapped to the grid.
Grid used for monospaced layout. All noncursive characters are treated as equal; every character is centered within a single grid space by default.

CssProperty.name: -ms-progress-appearance
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether a progress control displays as a bar or a ring.

CssProperty.name: -ms-text-kashida-space
CssProperty.description: Sets or retrieves the ratio of kashida expansion to white space expansion when justifying lines of text in the object.

CssProperty.name: -ms-perspective-origin-x
CssProperty.description: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

CssProperty.name: -ms-perspective-origin-y
CssProperty.description: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

CssProperty.name: -ms-interpolation-mode
CssProperty.description: Gets or sets the interpolation (resampling) method used to stretch images.

entry.description: The box's position is calculated according to the 'absolute' model.
